net.java.balloontip
Class BalloonTip

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  net.java.balloontip.BalloonTip
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
CustomBalloonTip
public class BalloonTip
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A balloon tip which can be attached to about any JComponent

Author:
Bernhard Pauler
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
static class BalloonTip.AttachLocation
          Where should the balloon's tip be located, relative to the attached component ALIGNED makes sure the balloon's edge is aligned with the attached component
static class BalloonTip.Orientation
          Should the balloon be placed above, below, right or left of the attached component?

                  java.lang.String text)
Constructor A simple constructor, the balloon tip will get a default look

Parameters:
attachedComponent - Attach the balloon tip to this component
text - The contents of the balloon tip (may contain HTML)

                  java.lang.String text,
                  BalloonTipStyle style,
                  boolean useCloseButton)
Constructor

Parameters:
attachedComponent - Attach the balloon tip to this component
text - The contents of the balloon tip (may contain HTML)
style - The balloon tip's looks
useCloseButton - If true, the balloon tip gets a close button

BalloonTip

public BalloonTip(javax.swing.JComponent attachedComponent,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  BalloonTipStyle style,
                  BalloonTip.Orientation orientation,
                  BalloonTip.AttachLocation attachLocation,
                  int horizontalOffset,
                  int verticalOffset,
                  boolean useCloseButton)
Constructor

Parameters:
attachedComponent - Attach the balloon tip to this componen
text - The contents of the balloon tip (may contain HTML)
style - The balloon tip's looks
orientation - Orientation of the balloon tip
attachLocation - Location of the balloon's tip within the attached component
horizontalOffset - Horizontal offset for the balloon's tip
verticalOffset - Vertical offset for the balloon's tip
useCloseButton - If true, the balloon tip gets a close button

BalloonTip

                  java.lang.String text,
                  BalloonTipStyle style,
                  BalloonTipPositioner positioner,
                  boolean useCloseButton)
Constructor

Parameters:
attachedComponent - Attach the balloon tip to this component
text - The contents of the balloon tip (may contain HTML)
style - The balloon tip's looks
positioner - Determines the way the balloon tip is positioned
useCloseButton - If true, the balloon tip gets a close button

public void enableClickToHide(boolean enabled)
Hide the balloon tip just by clicking anywhere on it

Parameters:

enableClickToClose

public void enableClickToClose(boolean enabled)
Permanently close the balloon tip just by clicking anywhere on it

Parameters:
enabled - if true, the balloon permanently closes when it's clicked

closeBalloon

public void closeBalloon()
If you want to permanently close the balloon, use this method. (If you just need to hide the balloon, use setVisible(false);) You cannot use this BalloonTip-instance anymore after calling this method!

setCloseButtonIcons

public static void setCloseButtonIcons(javax.swing.Icon normal,
                                       javax.swing.Icon pressed,
                                       javax.swing.Icon rollover)
Set the close-button icons for all balloon tips

Parameters:
normal -
pressed -
rollover - If you don't want a rollover, just set this to null...

setCloseButtonBorder

public void setCloseButtonBorder(int top,
                                 int left,
                                 int bottom,
                                 int right)
Sets the border of the balloon tip's close button. If no close button is used, nothing will happen.

Parameters:
top -
left -
bottom -
right -

setCloseButtonActionListener

public void setCloseButtonActionListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener act)
Replace the close button's behaviour (The default behaviour is to permanently close the balloon...) with your own action listener

Parameters:
act -
